thread.title: Pottstown-area churches schedule Easter Sunday worship services
thread.title_full: Pottstown-area churches schedule Easter Sunday worship services

author: For Medianews Group
title: Pottstown-area churches schedule Easter Sunday worship services
text:
St. John’s UCC
POTTSTOWN — St. John’s UCC, 11 S. Price St., welcomes all to join in worship on Sunday at 10:15 am. Easter Sunday will be observed and Communion will be celebrated. The service will be available for viewing on YouTube later in the day. The Little Pantry is stocked weekly with water, food, and personal care items for community members in need. Food items are also being collected to support Operation 143 which provides food to children in the Pottstown and surrounding school districts.
St. James ELCA
POTTSTOWN — At Saint James Lutheran Church, we welcome all to receive God’s love through Christ. Come celebrate the Resurrection of our Lord on Easter Sunday, March 31, with us! You are invited to worship on Sunday at 9:30 AM when we will rediscover the Alleluias in celebration of Jesus’ resurrection. Stay after worship for fellowship and share in a potluck breakfast sponsored by Saint James Church Council. There will be Easter activities for children (RSVP is appreciated. Call the church office and leave a message). All are welcome at 1101 E. High St. For more information, call (610) 326-2810 or visit
www.stjamespottstown.org
Trinity UCC
POTTSTOWN — This week we will have worship at Trinity at 10:15 a.m. Join us on Sunday as we celebrate
the Resurrection of Christ with a message reminding us that Christ truly rose for all of us, we are all the beloved children of God and loved without exception. We continue to offer a Community meal for anyone in need at 5:00 pm every Tuesday. This week, Pastor John and Frank are sponsoring the meal. All are welcomed, all are beloved children of God.
St. Peter’s Lutheran
POTTSTOWN — St. Peter’s Lutheran Church, 564 Glasgow St., will celebrate Easter Sunday at 9:30 a.m. Holy Communion Worship Service with Bridge Pastor, Rev Dr. Ann Baly. Visitors are always welcome. Worship with us online via Facebook on Sunday at 9:30 a.m. or any time during the week on Facebook, YouTube, and our website:
https://www.stpeterslutheranpottstown.com.
St. Paul’s UCC
POTTSTOWN — St. Paul’s United Church of Christ, 927 N. Franklin St., invites you to join us for worship on Easter Sunday, March 31, at 9:00 a.m. The service will include the sacrament of Holy Communion. Our service will also be broadcast live on our Facebook page at:
https://www.facebook.com/stpaulsuccpottstown. BREAKFAST WITH THE EASTER BUNNY, postponed last week, will be held Saturday, March 30, from 9 – 11 a.m. Come join us for a Pancake Breakfast, crafts, an Egg Hunt (10 a.m.), and photos with the Easter Bunny. Free will donation benefits our Capital Campaign. Our Diaper Bank is open on the fourth Wednesday of each month, from 10 am -12 noon. The next date is April 24. The Diaper Bank assists Pottstown families in need with diapers, wipes and other baby essentials.
First Baptist
POTTSTOWN — Join First Baptist Church of Pottstown this Easter Sunday, March 31, at 4:30 PM via Zoom or in person at 575 N. Keim St. Our Mission Offering for March will be our Easter Offering! FBC Learning Community will finish with “The Screwtape Letters,” 28-31, for our last meeting, this Easter Sunday, March 31, from 3:15- 4 pm in the library or via Zoom. FBC Book Group will continue their discussion of “Fever in the Heartland” on April 3, reading chapters 17-22. Access all FBC Zoom links at
www.FBCPottstown.org. This year’s CROP Hunger Walk, a community-wide event, will take place on Sunday, May 5, at 2:00 pm at the Hill School. Hosted by the Pottstown Cluster of Religious Communities, it raises money to combat food insecurity locally. Go to https://www.pottstowncluster.org/pottstowncrophungerwalk2024/ to learn more about this event.
Zion’s UCC
POTTSTOWN — March 31 is Easter Sunday and Zion’s welcomes all to in-person worship at 10:15 am. Rev. Austin Chinault, Zion’s United Church of Christ, Hanover and Chestnut streets, will have a message titled “The New Day.” The Sacrament of Holy Communion will be shared. We will be blessed with special music for
Easter by our Senior Choir, the Bell Choir and our trombone musicians. We invite all to join us as we celebrate the “Alleluia’s” of Easter. Services are livestreamed on Zion’s Facebook Page later at
www.facebook.com/zionsucc.
Cedarville UMC
NORTH COVENTRY — Join us Saturday at 1092 Laurelwood Road for an Easter Egg Hunt at 11:00 AM and Sunday for Easter services at 8:00 AM & 11:00 AM* (Traditional), and 9:30 AM* (Contemporary). Nursery* care is available. Additionally, there is a 6:30 AM Community Sunrise Service at Temple UMC. Visit
www.cedarvilleumc.org for resources and live-streamed worship (also on FB) or recorded services after Sunday. Scout Troop 95 will be selling flowers Saturday from 9 am to 5 p.m. and Sunday from 9 to 11 a.m. at Coventry Parlor at Laurel Locks. Mission First (Cedarville Church’s outreach at 414 E High Street) current needs: jelly, snacks, beef broth, tents, men’s boxers (all sizes) toiletries, gift cards. To help or donate (weekday assistance welcome) stop by or email Clare@missionfirstpottstown.org or call her at 610-326-0560. Saturday, April 6 is Camp Innabah Spring Fest & Egg Hunt (712 Pughtown Road, Spring City): 5K trail run and 2-mile fun, walk 9:00 (8:00-8:45 registration $35, to support scholarships (online reg. www.innabah.org). Then 11:30 – 2:00: campfire Hot Dogs and S’mores, an Egg Hunt with > 6,000 eggs for all age groups (including 0-2 & 50+) and Sling Shot Range, Wagon Rides, Tours, Hammocks, Ping Pong and more.
First UCC
ROYERSFORD — First UCC, 367 Washington St., Sunday School at 10 am. Worship will be held at 11 am, with Pastor Caroline Bashore preaching and celebrating Easter with Holy Communion. Egg Hunt after worship for the kids. All are Welcome! AA meetings every Thursday at 8 pm.
Bethel UMC
SPRING CITY — Bethel United Methodist Church, 952 Bethel Church Road, invites you to join us this Sunday, March 31, for the Easter Sunrise Service at 7:00 am in the Shick Shack and Easter Sunday Worship Service at the special time of 10 am in the Sanctuary, led by Pastor John Keretzman. We will be having a Women’s Tea on Saturday, May 18 at 1 pm, so save the date and tell your friends! Reservations will begin on April 1. Please contact the main office at 610-495-6807 or email Betheloffice952@aol.com to make your reservations. Follow us on Facebook at
www.facebook.com/bethelumchurch or visit our website at https://bethelumchurch.com for more information on church activities.
Brownback’s UCC
SPRING CITY — Join us this Sunday at 10 am for our Easter worship service in the Sanctuary led by Pastor Bill Wisneski. At 9:30 am, you can also join us for a Prayer Service in the Chapel and coffee in the lobby. We hope you’ll join us for some donuts and fellowship too! The next Young at Heart program (ages 55+) is on Thursday, April 11 at Noon with a program by Pigeon Creek Farm. The cost is $14, payable at the door. To register, please call 484-854-1682 by Sunday, April 7. Join us at 640 Ridge Road, or you can watch the service from home at:
https://www.facebook.com/BrownbacksChurch/live/
St. Luke Lutheran
GILBERTSVILLE — Join us at St. Luke Lutheran Church, Wilson Ave., for worship on Easter Sunday at 9:30 a.m. for Resurrection Sunday. Welcome to Pastor Tyson Frey as he leads us in worship. Communion will be celebrated. Connie Hukari will serve as lector. Services are broadcast at 91.3 FM and livestreamed at stlukegilbertsville.org. COMMUNITY CLOTHING RACK will be open from 1:00-4:00 p.m. on April 3 for donations. It will also be open for shoppers on April 10, 17, and 24.
Bethel Community
POTTSTOWN — On Sunday at 10:00 AM, it’s “Community Sunday School” for all ages and the topic will be “Freedom from the World” based on Colossians 2:16 – 23. At 11:00 AM, it’s Morning Worship for Resurrection Sunday – He Is Risen” when Bishop Jeffrey N. Leath, 128th Elected and Consecrated Bishop of the African Methodist Episcopal Church will be preaching. Psalmist Nadjah Nicole (NBC’s “The Voice,” Season 9). The service is Live on Facebook
https://www.facebook.com/BCCP575. The BCCP Food Pantry is Closed on Monday. On Tuesday at 6:00 PM and Thursday at 12:00 PM, it’s In-Person (Library) and Virtual ( 215-383-1625 Code 198087) “Community Bible Study.” Everyone is welcome!
Emmanuel Lutheran
POTTSTOWN — You are invited to celebrate The Resurrection of Our Lord on Easter Sunday at Emmanuel Lutheran Church, 150 N. Hanover St., on Sunday, March 31, at 10:45 AM. The Festival Service will feature traditional and contemporary aspects, special music by our Chancel Choir, Handbell Choir, the Alive In Christ Worship Team, as well as trumpeters, and the Sacrament of Holy Communion will be offered. Pastor Burlington Latshaw will lead the service and offer the day’s message. Services are broadcast live on our Facebook page at
https://www.facebook.com/EmmanuelPottstown. Outreach schedule for the coming week: Community Meals (use Walnut St. entrance) on Monday at 5 PM and Friday at 11:30 AM; Emmanuel’s Closet Clothing Ministry (use Hanover St. entrance) on Monday from 1-3 PM and 5:00-6:30 PM, Wednesday from 1:00-3:00 PM and Friday at 11 AM. NA meetings (use parking lot door closets to Walnut St.) on Monday and Wednesday at 7 PM, Saturday at 12 PM and 6 PM.
St. John’s ELC
BOYERTOWN — As children of God and disciples of Christ seeking peace and justice in the world, we welcome, affirm, and include all people into the fullness of God’s love. Join us for worship Sundays at 9:30 am and livestreamed on YouTube (St. John’s ELC Boyertown). Easter worship Sunday, March 31 at 9:30 am. 2024-25 Preschool Registration now open online! Free drive-through, take-out meal every Saturday evening from 4:30-5:30 pm. No registration necessary. For updates and further details, check our website at
stjohnsboyertown.org or call the office at 610.369.1024.
St. James Lutheran
LIMERICK — St James Lutheran Church is located at 93 Kugler Road. Our motto is “Following Jesus, we love God and Neighbor” and we wish you a very Happy Easter! We invite you to join us on Easter Sunday at one of two services. The Contemporary service starts at 9:00 AM with age-appropriate Christian Education classes following the Children’s message. Services are live-streamed on our website at
stjameslimerick.org. A time of Fellowship and Hospitality follows this service and on Easter it includes an egg hunt. The Traditional service begins at 10:45. Holy Communion will be served at both services and all are welcome to participate. BOX CITY is being held at Advent Lutheran in Harleysville on April 6 and 7. It is for youth in grades 6-12. Box City ’24 Youth Event is being held at Advent Lutheran in Harleysville on April 6 and 7. It is for youth in grades 6-12. For more information: https://www.facebook.com/adventlutheranharleysville/ New members class for St James Lutheran will be held this Spring. If you’re interested, contact the church at 610-287-7231, ext 12.
Calvary UCC
BARTO — Easter celebration of the resurrection will take place on Sunday, March 31, Beginning at 9:30 A.M. Professional Jazz and sacred worship artist Ron Stabinsky will be the guest musician for the day. Special solos will be played throughout the worship service. Pastor David Brumbaugh will preach the message “No One Can Take Away the Resurrection from Us!” Holy Communion will be shared during the service. Easter Flowers will be displayed in the sanctuary and may be picked up immediately after the worship service. The church office will be closed on April 1.
Grace Lutheran
POTTSTOWN — Grace Lutheran Church, 660 N. Charlotte St., welcomes you to worship with us as we observe Easter Sunday at 10:15 AM with Pastor Lauren Cain presiding over the communion service. The service will be live-streamed on our Facebook page
https://www.facebook.com/GLCPottstown. The service will remain on Facebook for viewing at a time convenient to our members and friends. Our guest organist will be Fred Astman.
St. Gabriel Catholic
STOWE — Join us for Easter – the Resurrection of Our Lord – Father Wilson and Deacon Ray will celebrate the Easter Vigil this evening at 8 PM and Easter Mass Sunday at 9 AM (the Rosary will be recited before Mass). The Blessing of the Easter Food will be today at 2:30 PM. We are now live-streaming services at
https://stgabrielstowepa.org/livestream/ BUS TRIP on Tuesday, May 14, to see “Daniel” at Sight & Sound in Lancaster. Depart from church at 10:30 AM. Return to church at approximately 7:00 PM. Cost is $169.00 – includes motorcoach transportation, lunch at Hometown Kitchen, tax and gratuity for lunch and ticket to the show. Make plans now to join us and ask your friends to join you. Reservations and payment due by April 1. Call the parish office 610-326-5127 to reserve your seat! LENTEN PARISH OUTREACH through Easter Sunday to help Birthright of Pottstown. We are collecting donations of needed items – clothing, diapers, bottles, etc. or monetary donations. For more information visit our Facebook page: www.facebook.com/sgsmstowe or our website https://stgabrielstowepa.org
Christ Lutheran
BARTO — Christ Lutheran Church will worship this Easter Sunday on Sunday, March 31, at an Easter Sunrise service beginning in the cemetery at 6:30 a.m. and then at 9:00 a.m., an Easter Festival service with activities for children. During both services, the Sacrament of Holy Communion will be received and the Rev. Matthew Finney will present the sermon for the morning. Coffee & Conversation will be held at 8:30 a.m. and 10:00 a.m. in the Welcome Center. Altar Guild for this Sunday is open and the Counting team is Team A for March. The church office will be closed on Monday, April 1, in observance of Easter. The Handbell Choir will rehearse on Wednesday, April 3 at 6:30 p.m. followed by the Senior Choir rehearsal at 7:00 p.m. The church is located at 222 Niantic Road between Routes 663 and 100 about a mile east of Bally.
Congregation Hesed Shel Emet
POTTSTOWN — Upcoming Shabbat services on April 6 and 20. Passover begins on April 22. Services are both in-person and virtual, via Zoom. Visitors are welcome. Rabbi Cynthia Kravitz hosts noontime and evening adult education sessions. Contact: 610-326-1717. Email: Hesedshelemet575@gmail.com. Services are both in-person and virtual, via Zoom. Visitors are welcome. Rabbi Cynthia Kravitz hosts noontime and evening adult education sessions. Contact: 610-326-1717. Email: Hesedshelemet575@gmail.com.
St. Paul’s UCC
AMITY — St. Paul’s UCC, 1979 Weavertown Road, Douglassville, is sponsoring a Spring Turkey Supper on Saturday, April 6, from 3-7 p.m. Eat in – Adults $15.00 – Children under 12 $8.00 – Kids under 4 Eat Free. Take Out Dinners – $15.00. Full turkey dinner buffet style with all the sides: turkey, potato filling, green beans, corn, pepper cabbage, cranberry sauce, roll and butter. Soup, coffee and pie will be served at the table. Handicapped accessible and youth to help with buffet if needed. A White Elephant Yard Sale will be held on Friday, April 5, from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. and Saturday, April 6, 8 am – till?
http://www.stpaulsuccamity.org
SUBMIT YOUR NEWS: Area houses of worship are invited to share their news for our free weekly listings. Email information to Mercury Editor Tony Phyrillas at tphyrillas@pottsmerc.com. Submissions will run on a space-available basis and are subject to editing. The information must be submitted before Noon on Thursday for publication in that Saturday’s edition. Please use the words “Church News” in the subject line of the email.
